chunk_analysis.page_text:
STATE OF OHIO, COUNTY OF JEFFERSON, To-wit:
I, Robert L. Quinn, a Notary Public of, in and for Jefferson County, Ohio, DO CERTIFY that Louis Wisniewski and Bertha J. Wisniewski, his wife, whose names are signed to the writing above bearing date the 25th day of October, 1947, have this day acknowledged the same before me in my said county.
Given under my hand this 5th day of November 1947.

Robert L. Quinn
Notary Public as aforesaid

My Commission expires:
Dec 9 48

STATE OF WEST VIRGINIA, COUNTY OF BROOKE, TO-WIT:
The foregoing paper writing was this day Dec 10th 1947 at 11:40 AM, presented for record in my office, and thereupon together with the certificate thereto annexed, is admitted to record.

Teste: George Short
County Court of Brooke County

15819

THIS DEED, MADE this 25th day of October, 1947, by and between EMILIO BONACUCIA and MARY BONACUCIA, his wife, Grantors, and hereinafter known and designated as parties of the first part, and the L & P OPERATING COMPANY, a corporation, Grantee, and hereinafter known and designated as party of the second part;

WITNESSETH, that for and in consideration of the sum of Five ($5.00) Dollars, and other good and valuable considerations, the receipt of which is hereby acknowledged, the said parties of the first part do hereby grant unto the party of the second part, the following described property, that is to say:

Four certain tracts or parcels of land, situate in Cross Creek District, Brooke County, West Virginia:

The first three parcels being same conveyed to Kelly L. Virden by Deed of Mrs. Kate J. Brennen, et al, bearing date March 26, 1919, and recorded in Deed Book 47, page 245, in the office of the Clerk of the County Court of Brooke County, West Virginia, to which Deed reference is here made, said property being therein described as follows:

Three certain tracts or parcels of land, located as hereinafter reserved situate in Cross Creek District, Brooke County, W.Va., the first of said tracts or parcels of land being the same conveyed to said Kate J. Brennen by Deed of Thomas Bray, bearing date May 20, 1922, and now of record in Deed Book 94, page 510, of the county records of said county of Brooke in which said deed, said land is described substantially as follows: The following described property, situate in said District and bounded and described as follows: Beginning at a stone and corner to said Bray and Kate J. Lesser; thence North 89½ degrees East 13.7 poles to a post on the old line of the Bray farm; thence South 87½ degrees East to a point on said line, so as to make twenty-five acres, with the following additional lands: said dividing line to be South 3.9° East to the line on the south side of the "Cowley" tract of land and to W. L. Miller's line, thence with said Miller's line North 89½ degrees West to a stone corner at the run; thence with the meanders of the run thirty-two and eight-tenths poles to a white stump; thence with the line of land of said Kate J. Lesser, North 109.2 poles to the beginning, containing Twenty-five acres.

The second of said tracts or parcels of land situated in said district, county and state, adjoining the tract of land above described, was conveyed to Joseph J. Brennen by Thomas J. Brennen and Jesse Brennen and wife on the 19th day of May, 1902, with other lands which deed is of record in Deed Book No. 38, page 43 of said Brooke County records, wherein said property is described substantially as follows: A certain tract of land containing five acres more or less, which was conveyed to the said James Brennen by one Thomas Bray, being all of the remaining portion of the land conveyed by said Bray in said deed, and which was not conveyed by said James Brennen to Joseph Spahel and W. J. Rice by deed dated January 30, 1904, which latter deed is now of record in Deed Book 43, page 103, of the deed records of said county.

The third of said tracts of land hereinbefore mentioned and hereby conveyed is described in deed to James Brennen and in deed of Jesse Brennen and wife to Joseph J. Brennen and Thomas J. Brennen, above referred to as follows: BEGINNING at a point in the Lazearville and Colliers road, corner to S. E. Loy, now F. L. Norton; thence S. 54° 21' E. 396 feet to a point in said road; thence S 22° 30' E. 155.1 feet to a point in said road; thence North 50° 22' E. 133 feet to a point in said road and corner to land owned by Clark S. Nicholas now Bricker; thence by lands of said Bricker S. 79° 10' E. 717.75 feet to corner of lands of said Bricker and land formerly owned by Jesse Brennen; thence by lands formerly of said Brennen, North 47° 21' W. 682 feet to other lands of said Loy, now Norton; thence by the same, North 38° 50' E. 440 feet to the place of beginning, containing 9.92 acres.

The fourth tract of land being a parcel conveyed to Lelia Virian by Deed of John C. Thomas and wife bearing date May 19, 1919, recorded in Deed Book 83, page 453 of the deed records of Brooke County, in which deed the said property is described as follows: "A piece or parcel of land situate in Cross Creek District, Brooke County, West Virginia, and more particularly described as follows: BEGINNING at a post in a line running through the lands of John C. Thomas, one of the grantors herein, said post being S 43° 30' W. 254.5 perches from the north line at S. 62° 30' E. 34 perches from a post in said line; thence in a southerly direction S 43° 30' W. 343.3 feet to a post; thence in a northerly direction N. 559.35' W. 556.5 feet to a post in the original Cox line; thence in a southerly direction S 700° 30' W. 956.7 feet to a post; thence in a northerly direction N 51° 50' E. 184.95 feet to a post; thence in a northerly direction N 58° 30' E. 84.2 feet to a post; thence in a northerly direction E 79° 25' E. 107.1 feet to a post; thence in a southerly direction S 65° 25' E. 636.7 feet to the point of beginning, containing seven and tenth tenth (.7) acres, more or less.

There is hereby reserved from the above parcel the vein of coal underlying the lands herein described known as the third vein of coal which is below the bed of the Ohio River.

detailed_samples.reasoning: This document contains an actual, explicit mineral rights reservation in the final paragraph:
This document contains an actual, explicit mineral rights reservation in the final paragraph:
This document contains an actual, explicit mineral rights reservation in the final paragraph:

Robert L. Quinn
